xwikidoc.content: <zladlie> has joined #phenotips 10:28 <zladlie> Hello, I have a question about the phenotips upgrade script 11:29 <sdumitriu> Hi zladlie 11:29 <zladlie> Hi, how are you? 11:30 <sdumitriu> In a day full of conference calls.. 11:30 <sdumitriu> I have 30 minutes 11:30 <sdumitriu> You? 11:30 <zladlie> No problem, should be a short question 11:31 <zladlie> There is the upgrade script upgrade-phenotips.sh. When we run this, I assume it updates the base Phenotips components? How do we keep any custom modifications to base files, such as a skin update to template files like pdffooter.vm? 11:32 <zladlie> I am well 11:32 <sdumitriu> Well, it depends where these changes are 11:32 <sdumitriu> It overrides all the jars, so if you have a custom patched jar, you'll need to manually rebuild and replace that one 11:33 <sdumitriu> But changes that are in the database won't be replaced 11:33 <zladlie> Are changes in site xml files replaced? 11:33 <sdumitriu> The second step of the upgrade, the one with the distribution manager, tries to do a 3-way merge between the previous official version, your current version, and the new official version 11:34 <sdumitriu> If it manages to cleanly merge, it will do that automatically 11:34 <sdumitriu> If there are changes in the same place, it will ask you what to do 11:34 <sdumitriu> In which case you'll have to manually check after the upgrade if it's in a good state or not 11:35 <sdumitriu> The changes in the xml files aren't replaced 11:35 <zladlie> Sounds good, thank you very much 11:37 <zladlie> I also have a meeting to run to :) Have a good day 11:37 <sdumitriu> Bye 11:37 <zladlie> has left #phenotips
